interjection: 1. Used alone as a way of apologising to someone for something that you have done which has upset them or caused them difficulties. English = 'Sorry', 'I'm sorry' and so on.
verbLexeme: 1. To wish you had not done something, especially something which has caused someone pain or difficulties. English = regret, feel sorry.
nominalLexeme: 1. A feeling you have when you wish you had not done something. English = regret.
